Field Descriptions: "The dispenser type, which further clarifies the dispenser class in the
field above. Valid values are these:
The Pharmacy zip code from the NCPDP based pharmacy information
Groups prescribers together into prescriber networks. Prescriber
networks are used to restrict which prescribers a member may go to
for treatment by attaching these networks to plans. Plans also attach
special pricing or copays to prescriber networks to o
Prescriber submitted on the pharmacy claim. (Can sometimes be
DEA#. Qualify using Prescriber Id Qualifier = ‘12’.)
The Code qualifying the type of Prescriber ID submitted.
The corresponding NPI associated with the Submitted Prescriber ID
The corresponding DEA ID associated with the Submitted Prescriber
ID.  The standard DEA ID is 9 characters. However, RxTRACK
includes at least one extra character indicating licensing at the end of
the standard DEA ID. When building queries, to match this
The prescriber’s first name as indicated within the NCPDP information
contained within the RxCLAIM system. If prescriber match is found in
the prescriber table, list last name.
The prescriber’s first name as indicated within the NCPDP information
contained within the RxCLAIM system. If a prescriber match is found
in the prescriber table, list first name.
The prescriber’s middle initial as indicated within the NCPDP
information contained within the RxCLAIM system. If a prescriber
match is found in the prescriber table, list first name.
Prescriber Specialty Code, either user-defined or loaded from the
NTIS Prescriber Load, as stored in the Prescriber Specialty File
